text: Could anyone elaborate on the problems/conflicts they've run into using React on HubSpot?  Asking because I think I've actually found a pretty good Webpack/React build solution that works within the template/module system, but now I'm nervous that we're going to hit a wall when we run into these problems.

Traditionally a lot of the issues have been regarding the necessity of a build phase in general and working with the cloud IDE environment. With themes functionality and the ability to lock certain folders and even use CI, there are a lot more options around that now.

I've had a couple conflicts with HubSpot itself (forms and CTAs use React by default, and can sometimes cause conflicts in React Dev Tools during development, but not usually).

Thanks Mark, that's very helpful... we've been experimenting with using webpack to break out a component for each module as a separate app/entrypoint, and I think that's acutually working pretty well for the build phase. I'll have to test it out in the conflict situations you mentioned above.
